column4: you should just be able to use the command "sudo mount /dev/sda1 (or whatever) /mnt/windows"

i tried that but it says it cant mount it and that i should go into windows and use the safely remove hardware comman for some reason,it also gives me the option of useing the --force command but i dont want to risk damanaged any data on this partition
windows didn't write the journal properly... you need to start windows up, and shut it down again (properly), then it should mount.
